title: Love Under the Sun
text: Love Under the Sun () is a 2003 Hong Kong <a href="musical%20film">musical</a> <a href="short%20film">short film</a> directed by <a href="Andy%20Lau">Andy Lau</a>. It depicts an evening ball in which a rumor spreads among the guests that one among them has contracted <a href="AIDS">AIDS</a>. The film was meant to raise awareness about AIDS and dispel common <a href="HIV%20and%20AIDS%20misconceptions">misconceptions regarding its contagiousness</a>. It features an <a href="all-star">all-star</a> cast of Lau and various other <a href="Hong%20Kong%20cinema">Hong Kong cinema</a> actors and <a href="Cantopop">Cantopop</a> singers. The music is mostly arranged from Classical works such as "<a href="F%C3%BCr%20Elise">Für Elise</a>" and "<a href="Carmen">Carmen</a>" with added or changed lyrics.
